summary: Michelle Combs is identified as the sender of fax transmissions to Barry Harrelson of the ARRB (Assassination Records Review Board). These transmissions contain briefing questions for the ARRB regarding the CIA's Directorate of Science and Technology (DS&T) and Directorate of Operations (DO). The questions pertain to various topics related to the JFK assassination, including records related to the HTLINGUAL project, Castro assassination plots, destroyed records, Mexico City station activities, operational funding, relationships with journalists, the QKENCHANT project, and Clay Shaw. The documents suggest that Michelle Combs was involved in preparing questions for the ARRB to use when briefing on CIA activities related to the JFK assassination.
significance: Michelle Combs' significance lies in her role in preparing briefing questions for the ARRB regarding CIA activities and records related to the JFK assassination. Her questions indicate areas of interest and potential scrutiny by the ARRB concerning the CIA's involvement and knowledge of events surrounding the assassination.
